headline: Margo Lion, 75, Independent and ‘Passionate’ Broadway Producer, Dies
abstract: In an era when big-budget theater was an increasingly corporate affair, Ms. Lion was a proudly independent producer.
lead_paragraph: Margo Lion, a theater producer who was largely responsible for bringing “Jelly’s Last Jam” and “Hairspray” to Broadway and played a major role in other important shows, including “Angels in America,” died on Friday in Manhattan. She was 75.
